Values: Any subset of {nuclear, oil, OCGT, CCGT, coal, geothermal, biomass}
Description: List of conventional power plants to include in the model from ``resources/powerplants.csv``. If an included carrier is also listed in ``extendable_carriers``, the capacity is taken as a lower bound.

Values: Any subset of {solar, onwind, offwind-ac, offwind-dc, hydro}
Description: List of renewable generators to include in the model.

Sets the retirement method for converntional generators. If ``technical`` all generators ``p_nom_min`` are set to ``p_nom`` to prevent selling off of the asset. Retirements are then tracked in post-proccessing. If ``economic`` existing plants have their ``p_nom_min`` set as ``0``,  ``p_nom_max`` set to ``p_nom``,  and capital costs set to fixed costs. Generators with ``p_nom`` are then added to handle capacity expansion."
Settings for reserve requirements following `GenX <https://genxproject.github.io/GenX.jl/stable/Model_Reference/core/#Operational-Reserves>`_
Whether to take operational reserve requirements into account during optimisation
share of total load
share of total renewable supply
fixed reserve capacity

Defines existing or non-existing conventional and renewable power plants to be extendable during the optimization. Conventional generators can only be built/expanded where already existent today. If a listed conventional carrier is not included in the ``conventional_carriers`` list, the lower limit of the capacity expansion is set to 0.
Adds extendable storage units (battery and/or hydrogen) at every node/bus after clustering without capacity limits and with zero initial capacity.
Adds extendable storage units (battery and/or hydrogen) at every node/bus after clustering without capacity limits and with zero initial capacity.

Adds extendable linksat every connection where there are lines or HVDC links without capacity limits and with zero initial capacity. Hydrogen pipelines require hydrogen storage to be modelled as ``Store``.
Datasource for electrical load data. ``EFS`` pulls future state level electrical demand data. ``EIA`` pulls historical balancing level electrical demand dataa.
(UNDER DEVELOPMENT) Extracts EFS data according to level of adoption
(UNDER DEVELOPMENT) Extracts EFS data according to speed of electrification
(UNDER DEVELOPMENT) Scales future demand according to the AEO scenario
Settings to activate and configure demand response
Allowable load to be shifted per snapshot. Set to 0 to turn off demand response. Set to 'inf' to not enforce capacity limits.
Cost to store one unit of energy for one hour
Configure electric imports from regions outside of model scope
Enable electric imports

Cost of electric imports from regions outside of model scope. ``False`` will set cost to ``0``. ``True`` will pull in wholesales electric prices. ``float`` will assign a user specified value. ``carrier`` will take average marginal cost of the carrier..
CO2 emissions of electric imports from regions outside of model scope.
Enable capacity limit for electric imports from regions outside of model scope
Volume limit for electric imports from regions outside of model scope (in % of total demand). Set to ``inf`` to not enforce volume limits.
Balancing period for electric imports from regions outside of model scope.
Configure electric exports to regions outside of model scope
Enable electric exports

Cost of electric exports to regions outside of model scope. ``False`` will set cost to ``0``. ``True`` will pull in wholesales electric prices. ``float`` will assign a user specified value. ``carrier`` will take average marginal cost of the carrier..
Enable capacity limit for electric exports to regions outside of model scope
Volume limit for electric exports to regions outside of model scope (in % of total demand). Set to ``inf`` to not enforce volume limits.
Balancing period for electric exports to regions outside of model scope.
